channel.title: sillygwailo tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from sillygwailo.

item.description: I’m going to Mississauga today by GO Transit. Cool, right?
Don’t wear a baseball cap to a skin assessment session, that’s my baseball cap advice for the day.

@Kimli What’s an example of something that’s not working? Not because I think I have a solution, but because I have the same combo and maybe I’m missing something (that is, maybe I got used to something and there’s a better way to live).

@CanBball GLOBL JAM felt a bit too expensive to attend live this year, but I hope you hold it again next year. It was fun to watch on TV, and if any of the games take place in the Toronto/Hamilton area next year, I’ll go in person. #GLOBLJAM https://t.co/dOO7MkbJhl
@CanBball Any chance of introducing the Elam Ending to the rules for GLOBL JAM next year? It would mean no more backcourt fouls and no rushed possessions at the end of the game. #GLOBLJAM
Does anybody know what the big news story will be tomorrow?
Carlos Santana is ridiculous.

@CanBball GLOBL JAM felt a bit too expensive to attend live this year, but I hope you hold it again next year. It was fun to watch on TV, and if any of the games take place in the Toronto/Hamilton area next year, I’ll go in person. https://t.co/dOO7MkbJhl

TIL about @torontolibrary’s online title recommendation form, which limits releases only to less than 2 years old and one purchase request per calendar month. What can I, personally, do to get the library to change its policy lift those limits? https://t.co/03xesNzKfV
Pitcher’s duels are boring. There, I said it.
@inHrEye Ah, check the time of an event, gotcha. OK, standing down.

@inHrEye Hold on, say that again? Your smartwatch couldn’t tell you the time because of the Rogers outage? The fact that there’s no watch face without a clock on it is literally the only reason I don’t own an Apple Watch. https://t.co/FAXB1M6sRE

Pandemic milestone: I invoked my “find a random nearby coffee shop and give me walking directions to it” shortcut, though I ultimately came up empty. All of them were either too fancy or closed today.
Look ma, I’m in a Haliburton County newspaper! https://t.co/csvNauCRzj

This wouldn’t work for most cities, but Toronto (Canada’s largest, and therefore best, city) could use something like the @OurCommons website, and especially something like @openparlca. https://t.co/k9qbc27bUK

A couple of times recently, I made a mild joke that had women I didn’t know laugh their asses off. One was about when I didn’t have legroom at Massey Hall and I joked that it was just the way I liked it. Today I said to one, “Don’t follow us, we don’t know where we’re going.”
They were intended as mildly funny jokes, just to relieve the awkwardness (awkwardity?) of the situation, not for them to bust out laughing.
Maybe they were high? I can’t tell if someone is high just by looking at them.
“Only go up the CN Tower once in your life,” said the guy who’s now been up it 3 times in his life.
I guess the deal’s off, so I’m sticking around here.
https://t.co/BuPNCh60lV

New series: My Pet Peeves.
Pet peeve: When people write words like “anxiousness” and “briefness” when there’s beautiful words like “anxiety” and “brevity” just looking at them like in the distracted boyfriend meme.
Saying them out loud, fine, I’ll give you a pass. But when writing them out you have a chance to press the backspace key.
Pet peeve: People talking while I’m walking in front of them. I don’t have an explanation for it, it just gets on my nerves. I let people pass me when that happens.

Now that I own a backlit Kindle, I can go to a dimly-lit bar and read a book. https://t.co/IKA2GXVPgi
Is there a bar, dimly-lit or otherwise, in Toronto where I can read a book and not be looked at funny?
How many of these bars survived the pandemic? https://t.co/l73DaQx21H
@wjfarr @DumasRaphael https://t.co/hn25I25qZw
@dailysimpsons https://t.co/pJStWDrGfu

I took at call at work today, and the customer was looking for someone named Richard who wasn’t me, so I thought he was asking for the other Richard in my department, but it was actually for someone we call Rich, not in my department. Now I can’t stop thinking about Mrs. Bucket. https://t.co/gdmuUOUArE

Today was Tall Women Day in Toronto, evidently. #TallWomenDay
Looks like I was out of town for Tall Women Day last year. That’s why I missed it. #TallWomenDay
It’s weird that Tall Women Day isn’t on a predictable day. It was in September in 2020, November in 2021, and July in 2022. Huh? #TallWomenDay
